description: ITIL Practitioner is a show (and qualification) developed for those IT managers and leaders who are seeking guidance on the implementation of an ITIL based framework and ITIL based processes. It is also directed at managers and leaders who are seeing to make improvements to their current ITIL based structure. In this show we cover topics ranging identifying areas for improvement and ensuring stakeholder engagement through to Organization Change Management; managing the “people” affected by and involved in transformational change. If you’re looking for a starting point to transformational change, then this is the show for you.
descriptionMD: ** Look for our partner PassionIT Group's information [HERE](https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/ITIL_OVERVIEW.zip)  Codes for offers are available to members and in the download in the second episode**  Practitioner is a show (and qualification) developed for those IT managers and leaders who are seeking guidance on the implementation of an ITIL based framework and ITIL based processes. It is also directed at managers and leaders who are seeing to make improvements to their current ITIL based structure. In this show we cover topics ranging identifying areas for improvement and ensuring stakeholder engagement through to Organization Change Management; managing the “people” affected by and involved in transformational change. If you’re looking for a starting point to transformational change, then this is the show for you.
name: Accredited ITIL - Practitioner
subtitle: ITIL Practitioner

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Jo introduce the upcoming ITIL Practitioner series. Jo explains who this series is intended for and what to expect while prepping for your ITIL Practioner exam.
episodes.title: Intro to ITIL Practitioner
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.003 --> 00:00:02.940
Welcome to ITProTV.

2
00:00:02.940 --> 00:00:06.422
[CROSSTALK]

3
00:00:06.422 --> 00:00:08.248
[MUSIC]

4
00:00:08.248 --> 00:00:11.967
>> You're watching ITProTV.

5
00:00:11.967 --> 00:00:14.153
>> Welcome to your
ITIL Practitioner series.

6
00:00:14.153 --> 00:00:16.540
I'm your show host, Cherokee Boose.

7
00:00:16.540 --> 00:00:21.290
In this episode, we'll really introduce,
well, at least Jo will, our ITIL expert,

8
00:00:21.290 --> 00:00:26.130
introduce what this series is gonna be all
about and what we should come to expect.

9
00:00:26.130 --> 00:00:28.130
So, Jo, how's it going?

10
00:00:28.130 --> 00:00:29.880
>> I'm absolutely great,
how are you, Cherokee?

11
00:00:29.880 --> 00:00:33.040
>> I'm just glad you're here, because I
certainly can't deliver this information.

12
00:00:33.040 --> 00:00:37.150
So I'm really hoping that you'll
be able to explain to us what we

13
00:00:37.150 --> 00:00:38.842
have to look forward to in the series.

14
00:00:38.842 --> 00:00:43.947
>> Okay, well, in the ITIL Practitioner
class, the ITIL Practitioner

15
00:00:43.947 --> 00:00:48.457
show is unlike any other ITIL
show that you have ever watched.

16
00:00:48.457 --> 00:00:51.644
It's unlike any class that
you've ever undertaken, and

17
00:00:51.644 --> 00:00:56.370
it's unlike any qualification in
terms of ITIL that you have ever sat.

18
00:00:56.370 --> 00:01:01.020
ITIL Practitioner does not fit
in with the actual life cycle

19
00:01:01.020 --> 00:01:05.580
stream of all of your other ITIL courses.

20
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:11.790
This particular show will look
at the implementation of ITIL.

21
00:01:12.980 --> 00:01:16.791
So, there is an assumption there and
that you have.

22
00:01:16.791 --> 00:01:21.549
And in fact, it's a prerequisite
you must have completed your ITIL

23
00:01:21.549 --> 00:01:26.830
foundation in order to be able to
sit the ITIL practitioner test.

24
00:01:26.830 --> 00:01:30.900
My recommendation is that you've
also completed your MALC as well.

25
00:01:30.900 --> 00:01:34.300
In that you have actually gone
through your intermediates, and

26
00:01:34.300 --> 00:01:37.340
you have attained ITIL expert status.

27
00:01:37.340 --> 00:01:41.480
And at that point in time,
this is when we look at ITIL practitioner.

28
00:01:41.480 --> 00:01:46.600
The practitioner certification is
designed for those consultants,

29
00:01:46.600 --> 00:01:52.060
those specialists, and those managers
who are looking to implement ITIL.

30
00:01:52.060 --> 00:01:55.800
Implement either ITIL as a whole or
implement maybe one or

31
00:01:55.800 --> 00:01:57.690
two processes in ITIL.

32
00:01:57.690 --> 00:02:03.380
So it is designed for those experts
who understand ITIL completely.

33
00:02:03.380 --> 00:02:09.480
You cannot implement unless you understand
what you're trying to implement.

34
00:02:09.480 --> 00:02:13.180
Which is why even though the prerequisite
is just at the foundation level

35
00:02:13.180 --> 00:02:14.470
certificate.

36
00:02:14.470 --> 00:02:17.970
I would recommend that you have
done other intermediates and

37
00:02:17.970 --> 00:02:22.260
even MALC before you attempt
to implement anything.

38
00:02:22.260 --> 00:02:26.180
You cannot implement anything, bearing
in mind that you have to adopt ITIL and

39
00:02:26.180 --> 00:02:28.200
then adapt it to your environment.

40
00:02:28.200 --> 00:02:30.212
You have to understand what
you're adopting first.

41
00:02:30.212 --> 00:02:30.770
So and as I said,

42
00:02:30.770 --> 00:02:35.300
you can't implement anything unless
you have a full understanding of it.

43
00:02:35.300 --> 00:02:39.400
Now this class, this particular
course is completely different

44
00:02:39.400 --> 00:02:42.880
to any of the other ITIL
shows in its format.

45
00:02:42.880 --> 00:02:47.572
The recommendations from Axelos are for

46
00:02:47.572 --> 00:02:53.092
the ITIL practitioner
that we have around about

47
00:02:53.092 --> 00:02:58.350
a 25 to 35% tutor led study experience.

48
00:02:58.350 --> 00:03:05.824
The remainder of that, between 65 and
75% is undertaken by exercises.

49
00:03:05.824 --> 00:03:10.789
And these are exercises designed
to test your ability to be able

50
00:03:10.789 --> 00:03:15.730
to implement ITIL and
implement any of the processes in ITIL.

51
00:03:15.730 --> 00:03:20.590
So, this test can actually test
you on any of these processes.

52
00:03:20.590 --> 00:03:22.602
Which is why I say, you have to know them.

53
00:03:22.602 --> 00:03:25.150
You have to know them like
the back of your hand,

54
00:03:25.150 --> 00:03:27.270
because your test is going to test you.

55
00:03:27.270 --> 00:03:28.620
It's gonna give you a scenario, and

56
00:03:28.620 --> 00:03:33.170
it's going to test you on your ability
to adapt ITIL in that scenario.

57
00:03:33.170 --> 00:03:37.200
So as I've said,
you have to be able to adapt ITIL.

58
00:03:37.200 --> 00:03:40.290
So you have to know it in
order to be able to adapt it.

59
00:03:40.290 --> 00:03:45.277
So, as far as this particular show is
concerned, with the ITIL Practitioner

60
00:03:45.277 --> 00:03:50.186
show, you're not going to find as many
hours in our episodes as you have with

61
00:03:50.186 --> 00:03:55.122
all of the previous ITIL shows and
as you have with all of our intermediates.

62
00:03:55.122 --> 00:03:59.865
Because this particular show is focused
very much on your downloadable material

63
00:03:59.865 --> 00:04:03.644
and on the exercises contained
in that downloadable material.

64
00:04:03.644 --> 00:04:07.861
Now, as always,
with all of our other ITIL shows,

65
00:04:07.861 --> 00:04:12.482
we are available as
the professionals in the ITIL fora.

66
00:04:12.482 --> 00:04:15.940
We're available for
you if you have any questions.

67
00:04:15.940 --> 00:04:21.224
And in fact, in terms of feedback for your
exercises, I would tell you that, yes,

68
00:04:21.224 --> 00:04:26.224
definitely come back to us, and we'll be
able to advice in any way that we can.

69
00:04:26.224 --> 00:04:32.167
Now and I'm gonna talk to you in a moment
about the format of the actual study and

70
00:04:32.167 --> 00:04:35.151
the format of our examination as well.

71
00:04:35.151 --> 00:04:39.999
But what I would tell you is,
as I've already told you,

72
00:04:39.999 --> 00:04:44.125
we have huge emphasis on the exercises and
not so

73
00:04:44.125 --> 00:04:48.590
much emphasis on the actual
episodes themselves.

74
00:04:48.590 --> 00:04:50.990
This means you're going to be
doing a lot of work for yourself.

75
00:04:50.990 --> 00:04:52.230
Now there's a temptation there,

76
00:04:52.230 --> 00:04:54.590
and don't tell me that there
isn't because I know there is.

77
00:04:54.590 --> 00:04:57.520
>> I know, Jo, I was gonna ask you,
is this something that if I feel

78
00:04:57.520 --> 00:05:01.533
confident with, I can just skip over the
homework and not perform the exercises?

79
00:05:01.533 --> 00:05:03.597
>> Absolutely no,

80
00:05:03.597 --> 00:05:09.170
the problem with the people that
are taking the ITIL Practitioner classes.

81
00:05:09.170 --> 00:05:12.710
That sounds negative, doesn't it,
saying they've got a problem.

82
00:05:12.710 --> 00:05:16.140
But it's really, really easy to assume
that you've got enough information, and

83
00:05:16.140 --> 00:05:17.322
you know enough about ITIL.

84
00:05:17.322 --> 00:05:22.829
And therefore we don't have to take
the exercises because it's okay,

85
00:05:22.829 --> 00:05:24.492
we know everything.

86
00:05:24.492 --> 00:05:26.670
Let me let you into a little secret here.

87
00:05:26.670 --> 00:05:29.694
The ITIL practitioner test,
to be perfectly honest,

88
00:05:29.694 --> 00:05:31.937
the pass rate is not particularly high.

89
00:05:31.937 --> 00:05:32.770
And you know what?

90
00:05:32.770 --> 00:05:37.740
We see a significant drop in pass rate for
ITIL practitioner for

91
00:05:37.740 --> 00:05:41.020
those that don't undertake the exercises.

92
00:05:42.230 --> 00:05:44.894
The exercises are designed, and
they're for a specific reason, and

93
00:05:44.894 --> 00:05:47.573
that's why they're there available
in the downloadable material.

94
00:05:47.573 --> 00:05:51.578
Because they're designed to test
your ability to adapt ITIL,

95
00:05:51.578 --> 00:05:53.401
given certain situations.

96
00:05:53.401 --> 00:05:55.940
And we wanna make sure that
you know how to do that,

97
00:05:55.940 --> 00:05:58.720
because you're gonna be in
a real-world situation,

98
00:05:58.720 --> 00:06:03.270
where you have to implement ITIL, where
you have to adapt what's in the book.

99
00:06:03.270 --> 00:06:04.120
So as I've already said,

100
00:06:04.120 --> 00:06:06.020
there's an assumption that
you know what's in the book.

101
00:06:06.020 --> 00:06:09.427
And all of the intermediate and
all of the MALC tests and

102
00:06:09.427 --> 00:06:13.593
everything that you've done so
far, they will test your theory.

103
00:06:13.593 --> 00:06:18.191
What we're gonna test you here in ITIL
Practitioner is that you know how to use

104
00:06:18.191 --> 00:06:18.982
the theory.

105
00:06:18.982 --> 00:06:23.951
And so these exercises are designed
to give you certain scenarios and

106
00:06:23.951 --> 00:06:28.330
certain situations that test
your knowledge of the theory.

107
00:06:28.330 --> 00:06:30.327
So no, you can't skip the exercises,
Cherokee.

108
00:06:30.327 --> 00:06:31.895
>> I had to ask, Jo, I had to ask.

109
00:06:31.895 --> 00:06:35.017
>> [LAUGH] All right, so let's take
a look then in a little bit more

110
00:06:35.017 --> 00:06:37.673
depth at just what's going
to happen in this class.

111
00:06:37.673 --> 00:06:39.359
And right in front of you right now,

112
00:06:39.359 --> 00:06:41.900
you'll see what we call
the ITIL Practitioner Book.

113
00:06:41.900 --> 00:06:43.670
This is the official ITIL book.

114
00:06:45.110 --> 00:06:50.330
Now this is completely up to you, but I'm
gonna recommend that you go to your local

115
00:06:50.330 --> 00:06:52.450
book retailer, whoever that may be.

116
00:06:52.450 --> 00:06:55.680
Online, you can buy it from
Axelos if you want to.

117
00:06:55.680 --> 00:06:57.800
And you purchase this book.

118
00:06:57.800 --> 00:07:00.934
This book is, well, required.

119
00:07:00.934 --> 00:07:05.703
I'm gonna be referring to it
throughout the actual class itself,

120
00:07:05.703 --> 00:07:08.182
but this exam is an open book exam.

121
00:07:08.182 --> 00:07:09.225
And when I say open book,

122
00:07:09.225 --> 00:07:11.980
I don't mean any of the material
that you've got in front of you.

123
00:07:11.980 --> 00:07:15.330
I mean this book, right now,
that's on the screen,

124
00:07:15.330 --> 00:07:17.650
the official ITIL Practitioner Guidance.

125
00:07:17.650 --> 00:07:20.490
You can use this during your test.

126
00:07:20.490 --> 00:07:25.370
That should give you a little bit
of an insight as to exactly what

127
00:07:25.370 --> 00:07:30.530
this test entails because there's no other
ITIL qualification that's been open book.

128
00:07:30.530 --> 00:07:34.800
There's no other ITIL exam
that's open book, just this one.

129
00:07:34.800 --> 00:07:35.730
So what's in the book?

130
00:07:35.730 --> 00:07:38.140
Well, the book contains a tool kit,

131
00:07:38.140 --> 00:07:40.936
something that everybody's been
asking for, for a long, long time.

132
00:07:40.936 --> 00:07:44.240
And the tool kit is literally
just a set of templates.

133
00:07:44.240 --> 00:07:47.422
I get asked all the time,
do you have a template for an SLA?

134
00:07:47.422 --> 00:07:49.880
Do you have a template for a CSO register?

135
00:07:49.880 --> 00:07:53.730
Do you have a template for
a stakeholder worksheet or

136
00:07:53.730 --> 00:07:57.520
stakeholder analysis or
training needs analysis?

137
00:07:57.520 --> 00:07:58.900
Well, we do now.

138
00:07:58.900 --> 00:08:03.322
It's in this book, and you can refer
to these throughout your test.

139
00:08:03.322 --> 00:08:06.157
But more importantly,
throughout the case study and

140
00:08:06.157 --> 00:08:10.360
throughout your course exercises,
you're going to be using this book.

141
00:08:10.360 --> 00:08:14.490
And I'm gonna be referring to
specific pages in this book

142
00:08:14.490 --> 00:08:19.350
throughout our episodes
on ITIL Practitioner.

143
00:08:19.350 --> 00:08:21.441
>> Jill,
where can I find one of these books?

144
00:08:21.441 --> 00:08:25.466
>> Well, as I said just a little
while ago, any bookstore and

145
00:08:25.466 --> 00:08:29.740
any online retailer will be
able to sell you these books.

146
00:08:29.740 --> 00:08:31.850
You can buy it from the Axelos website.

147
00:08:31.850 --> 00:08:34.563
Just remember that the book
is produced in the UK.

148
00:08:34.563 --> 00:08:40.503
So the prices that you're quoting or that
you're going to be quoted are in pounds.

149
00:08:40.503 --> 00:08:44.240
And that remains static, but
of course, the exchange rate differs.

150
00:08:44.240 --> 00:08:46.711
So you're going to see different
prices in different places.

151
00:08:46.711 --> 00:08:50.260
It's still the same book, it's just
been dependent on the exchange rate when

152
00:08:50.260 --> 00:08:53.310
whoever that retailer is
bought that particular book.

153
00:08:53.310 --> 00:08:55.515
That's the only difference.

154
00:08:55.515 --> 00:08:58.310
You're gonna have a case study,
it's in your downloadable material.

155
00:08:58.310 --> 00:09:02.280
This case study is going
to be used in your test.

156
00:09:02.280 --> 00:09:06.310
And this case study refers to
a company called CruiseAlongCars and

157
00:09:06.310 --> 00:09:09.550
other organizations, subsidiary and
partner organizations,

158
00:09:09.550 --> 00:09:12.730
such as the DriveYou.com, etc, okay?

159
00:09:12.730 --> 00:09:16.200
So that case study, I'm going to be
referring to throughout the class, and

160
00:09:16.200 --> 00:09:20.940
I'm also going to be referring to that for
your exercises as well.

161
00:09:20.940 --> 00:09:26.480
So, as I've already told you,
the exam guidelines, or rather, the Axelos

162
00:09:26.480 --> 00:09:32.119
guidelines are that we spend between
65 and 75% of our time on exercises.

163
00:09:32.119 --> 00:09:36.093
And it mentions here a minimum of 50%,
and it is going to be a minimum of 50%.

164
00:09:36.093 --> 00:09:41.097
And I've already mentioned that these are
designed to emulate real world scenarios,

165
00:09:41.097 --> 00:09:42.544
real world experience.

166
00:09:42.544 --> 00:09:46.720
It's based on the holistic implementation
of all of our ITIL processes.

167
00:09:46.720 --> 00:09:50.071
So, it's very imperative
that you understand ITIL.

168
00:09:50.071 --> 00:09:51.788
In our subsequent episodes,

169
00:09:51.788 --> 00:09:56.046
the first episodes that we're going
to have in this particular show after

170
00:09:56.046 --> 00:10:00.389
this one are really going to be just
a recap on foundation, just to help us.

171
00:10:01.750 --> 00:10:04.010
So let's take a look then at,

172
00:10:04.010 --> 00:10:09.480
well, your expectations in terms
of the actual shows themselves.

173
00:10:09.480 --> 00:10:13.690
The syllabus, as I've already mentioned,
talks about ITIL concepts.

174
00:10:13.690 --> 00:10:18.480
It talks about the CSI approach and
guiding principles and metrics.

175
00:10:18.480 --> 00:10:20.160
We're going to be covering all of these.

176
00:10:20.160 --> 00:10:25.360
Now you might think that you've
already covered these in your

177
00:10:25.360 --> 00:10:29.320
previous sessions,
as you've looked at CSI, for instance.

178
00:10:29.320 --> 00:10:34.150
Well, you haven't, not at this angle and
not to this degree of depth.

179
00:10:34.150 --> 00:10:37.640
So Cherokee, when you mention about,
I don't need to do the exercise.

180
00:10:38.870 --> 00:10:43.800
Yeah, don't be overconfident, because this
is not what this is designed to test you.

181
00:10:43.800 --> 00:10:46.230
>> I'm not just understanding
the theory anymore.

182
00:10:46.230 --> 00:10:48.120
I have to know how to
implement it at this stage.

183
00:10:48.120 --> 00:10:53.020
>> Yeah, what we learnt in all of our
other shows is the actual theory itself.

184
00:10:53.020 --> 00:10:56.930
And we learned to absorb the theory, and
we learned to apply some of the theory.

185
00:10:56.930 --> 00:11:00.125
But now, we're learning to adapt a theory.

186
00:11:00.125 --> 00:11:03.825
So in our previous episodes,
in all of our other shows,

187
00:11:03.825 --> 00:11:06.750
we've learned to apply the theory.

188
00:11:06.750 --> 00:11:08.840
Now we're learning to adapt to theory.

189
00:11:08.840 --> 00:11:11.737
And so we're coming at this from
a completely different angle.

190
00:11:11.737 --> 00:11:15.340
And then of course, we're going
to have some exam prep as well.

191
00:11:15.340 --> 00:11:19.290
Here we are, if we look at Blooms
Taxonomy, here we are at sort of level

192
00:11:19.290 --> 00:11:24.630
four in analyzing and where level four and
level five almost as well.

193
00:11:24.630 --> 00:11:28.042
That's where we're coming
at this from there.

194
00:11:28.042 --> 00:11:32.181
So our approach is going to be
very much the learning itself,

195
00:11:32.181 --> 00:11:35.870
in other words,
through our shows and our episodes.

196
00:11:35.870 --> 00:11:39.800
But then we're also going to be
undertaking the exercises that I've said.

197
00:11:39.800 --> 00:11:42.610
And we're going to be learning
assessment techniques, and

198
00:11:42.610 --> 00:11:44.900
we're going to be taking a mock test.

199
00:11:44.900 --> 00:11:48.370
And lastly, really, for
this particular introduction,

200
00:11:48.370 --> 00:11:51.039
I'm just going to tell you a little
bit about your test itself.

201
00:11:52.340 --> 00:11:56.532
You have a multiple choice test, exactly
the same as all the other ITIL tests.

202
00:11:56.532 --> 00:12:00.393
Only this one is actually going
to be open book, cuz I've said,

203
00:12:00.393 --> 00:12:05.450
the only ITIL test that's open book,
and it's two hours and 15 minutes long.

204
00:12:05.450 --> 00:12:09.130
That's the longest ITIL
test that you've ever had.

205
00:12:09.130 --> 00:12:10.970
You're gonna get 40 questions, and

206
00:12:10.970 --> 00:12:14.450
these 40 questions are going
to be based on the case study.

207
00:12:14.450 --> 00:12:18.680
It's exactly the same case study
that we are going to be looking at

208
00:12:18.680 --> 00:12:21.070
throughout this particular show.

209
00:12:21.070 --> 00:12:22.540
It's not a different case study.

210
00:12:23.570 --> 00:12:24.940
So I always advise everybody,

211
00:12:24.940 --> 00:12:29.080
before they sit their test,
get to know your case study.

212
00:12:29.080 --> 00:12:31.020
Read it every single night if you need to.

213
00:12:31.020 --> 00:12:32.950
Just get to know your case study.

214
00:12:32.950 --> 00:12:38.600
You have to get a mark of 28 out of 40 on
this test in order to be able to pass.

215
00:12:38.600 --> 00:12:40.150
It's multiple choice,

216
00:12:40.150 --> 00:12:44.540
it's not complex multiple choice,
it's simple multiple choice.

217
00:12:44.540 --> 00:12:46.600
You've got one right answer, that's it.

218
00:12:46.600 --> 00:12:48.637
There's no points awarded,

219
00:12:48.637 --> 00:12:52.713
unlike in our intermediates,
where we had a point system.

220
00:12:52.713 --> 00:12:53.680
>> Partial credit or something like that?

221
00:12:53.680 --> 00:12:57.610
>> That's right, you had a point
system based on your best fit answer.

222
00:12:57.610 --> 00:13:01.040
Not on this one, you've either got
the right answer or the wrong.

223
00:13:01.040 --> 00:13:03.880
It's as simple as that,
very simple multiple choice.

224
00:13:03.880 --> 00:13:08.130
So it's very, very important that
you understand how we adapt to ITIL.

225
00:13:08.130 --> 00:13:12.300
Now, as I already mentioned, the early
prerequisite is for the ITIL foundation.

226
00:13:12.300 --> 00:13:15.500
But I would also recommend
that you get to know

227
00:13:15.500 --> 00:13:20.350
your other ITIL intermediates
before sitting a practitioner test.

228
00:13:20.350 --> 00:13:22.970
Because you simply cannot
implement something if you don't

229
00:13:22.970 --> 00:13:24.470
understand what you're implementing.

230
00:13:25.640 --> 00:13:27.820
So for now, what I'd like you to do is,

231
00:13:27.820 --> 00:13:32.840
I would like you to watch our foundation
recap and subsequent episodes.

232
00:13:32.840 --> 00:13:36.100
Our next two episodes are going
to be a recap of the foundation,

233
00:13:36.100 --> 00:13:39.018
just to give you that refresher
into all of those processes.

234
00:13:39.018 --> 00:13:46.032
And then, we'll then launch into
the ITIL practitioner body itself.

235
00:13:46.032 --> 00:13:47.656
And in these episodes,

236
00:13:47.656 --> 00:13:52.310
we'll be looking at various
techniques to actually adapt to ITIL.

237
00:13:52.310 --> 00:13:55.881
And then, of course,
towards the end of the show,

238
00:13:55.881 --> 00:13:58.552
we'll be going over a practice exam.

239
00:13:58.552 --> 00:14:03.088
And we'll be reviewing only the answers
in that practice exam, and also,

240
00:14:03.088 --> 00:14:07.632
I'll be giving you some hints and tips
on how to start with the exam as well.

241
00:14:07.632 --> 00:14:10.591
>> All right, perfect, Jo, thank you for
taking the time to explain that to us.

242
00:14:10.591 --> 00:14:11.830
Hope to see you soon.

243
00:14:11.830 --> 00:14:14.220
We've got a whole lot of
episodes headed your way.

244
00:14:14.220 --> 00:14:16.040
But for now, we'll go ahead and sign out.

245
00:14:16.040 --> 00:14:17.440
I've been your host, Cherokee Boose.

246
00:14:17.440 --> 00:14:18.200
>> And I'm Jo Peacock.

247
00:14:18.200 --> 00:14:20.552
>> See you next time here at ITProTV.

248
00:14:20.552 --> 00:14:26.510
[MUSIC]

249
00:14:26.510 --> 00:14:30.564
>> Thank you for watching ITProTV.

episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee define what a service is and what it means to you. Jo breaks it down to a granular level to make sure the definition is completely understood.
episodes.title: Service Definition

episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee explain Continual Service Improvement from a practitioner standpoint. Jo goes through the approach step by step offering guidance along the way. Mission and vision statements, 4P's of strategy, constraints and stakeholders are also covered.
episodes.title: CSI Approach

episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee continue examining the CSI approach. Jo explains how important it is to use an accurate baselines to see where you are, how far you've come and how far you need to go.
episodes.title: CSI Approach Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee cover Continual Service Improvement Principles. They define principles that should be applied to every improvement and every implementation initiative.
episodes.title: CSI Guiding Principles

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo introduce metrics and measurement. First Jo shares four reasons why we measure.  Next, Jo covers  the Vision to Measurement Tree.  Yhe ladies also doscuss how to develop a successful KPI. You will also take a look a how a balanced score can help provide a clear prescription as to what should be measured in order to achieve the balance from a variety of perspectives.
episodes.title: Metrics and Measurements

episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee begin by defining specific metric types. Jo explains the difference between leading, trailing, outside-in, and inside-out metrics. She also shows how scorecards influence service reporting. Next, you will see how to leverage reports and assessments through the use of tools like gap analysis and CMMI levels.
episodes.title: Metrics and Measurements Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo explain organizational change management. This approach may be different from what you think about when it comes to change management.  When it comes to Organizational Change Management  Jo  stresses it is essential to focus on the people to become successful. Jo also shares tools such as The Gartner Hype Cycle,  Bridges Phases of Transition,  JP Kotter's 8 Steps to help understand what individuals go thru during a time of change.  Lastly, they look at ways to help identify resistance.
episodes.title: Organizational Change Management

episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee  explain how communication is a two-way process. Although, we are communicating through various avenues all the time , Jo outlines specific communication methods such as a Stakeholder Communication Plan. Timing and frequency are also explained in addition to various additional points. Lastly, they look at an example communication path.
episodes.title: Communication

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo explain exceptions for the exam.  Jo also goes through the exercises and stresses the importance of completing them. She also provides exam tips such as reading and understanding your case study prior to taking the exam.
episodes.title: Introduction to Exercises

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Jo review some of the different techniques and details when sitting for your ITIL Intermediate exam.  They recommend downloading the sample paper for review.  Jo reviews the details on scoring of the exam.  She also has solid exam advice for delegates preparing for an exam.
episodes.title: Exam Review Introduction

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo reviews some of the different techniques and details when sitting for your ITIL Intermediate exam.  She recommend downloading the sample paper for review.  Jo reviews the details on scoring of the exam.  She also has solid exam advice for delegates preparing for an exam.
episodes.title: Exam Review

episodes.description: Exam review for ITIL Intermediate - Practitioner
episodes.title: Exam Review Part 2
